item.title: [LOG4J2-684] ExtendedThrowablePatternConverter does not print suppressed exceptions
item.description:
(Actual version was 2.0-rc2 but that wasn't available in the list.)

Currently, any potentially available suppressed exceptions are ignored by ConsoleAppender.

Instead, it should print those exceptions with the prefix "Suppressed: ". Be aware that suppressed exceptions are indented with a \t, recursively, in contrast to the way "Caused by: " is handled.

See Throwable.printStackTrace of Java 7 or higher for the implementation.

Feel free to use the code over at https://github.com/huxi/lilith/blob/master/lilith-data/logging/src/main/java/de/huxhorn/lilith/data/logging/ThrowableInfo.java if it helps.
item.summary: ExtendedThrowablePatternConverter does not print suppressed exceptions

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I also hit this problem. I really think Log4j should also print the suppressed exceptions stack traces.

Can you post your config file please?

What version are you using? Can you try the current version 2.3?

Hi Gary,
I was using version 2.2. Now tried with 2.3 and the result is the same: the suppressed exceptions are not printed in the log.
I'm using Sl4j 1.7.7 to drive Log4j, but I don't think it's performing any manipulation on the passed exception (like removing the suppressed exceptions).

My Log4j configuration is this:

		</Root>
	</Loggers>

I don't believe we ever added anything to print the suppressed exceptions. Now that we are on Java 7 the code that handles them can certainly be improved.

Mauro,

The method org.apache.logging.log4j.core.pattern.ThrowablePatternConverter.formatOption(Throwable, StringBuilder) uses java.lang.Throwable.printStackTrace(PrintWriter) to print a Throwable which prints suppressed exceptions. So I am surprised to read that the suppressed exceptions do not show up.

Can you provide a unit test?
